revised_title: Kew Committee's Annual Report: Observations, Experiments, and Instrument Verifications in 1874
tldr: The Kew Committee's annual report covers various scientific observations, experiments, and instrument verifications conducted in 1874. These include magnetic work, meteorological studies, electrometer operations, photoheliograph reexaminations, and thermometer verifications. The report also discusses the testing of anemometers using a steam-powered rotary machine and pendulum vibration experiments conducted in collaboration with the Great Trigonometrical Survey of India.
